author: NFT-DAO (the whole team)
title: NFT-DAO EZ-Honor contribution token
description: Open-source projects need a scalable way to recognize, reward & bolster reputation of committed contributors & incent good decision-making.

assessments.note: This is an interesting proposal to encourage and reward participation though a set of new tokens.

The problem and solution description is within the scope of the challenge. Offering financial incentives through tokens and bounties is a way to encourage community participation in the discussion of improvements for Catalyst and in my view having more people actively participating in Catalyst is a step towards wisdom of the crowds and an improvement in the ability to decision-making in relation to Catalyst itself. The proposal goes beyond creating solutions in decision making, being a promising idea to organize and distribute the workload. 

The distribution of contribution tokens to poll /proposals participants can help increase community participation in internal proposals for improving Catalyst and create a reputation model where members with more tokens end up being seen as more participatory, but as one of the objectives of the proposal is creating a tokenomics model there is still no way to know the effectiveness and impact of this.
assessments.reply: Agreed, we seek through this work to find a may that measures effectively.

assessments.note: They know how to ask for funding. All questions were answered, and this proposal is in complete alignment with the aim of this fund.

This proposal seeks to use incentive to drive contribution and recognition. It is something that is a great thing to try on NFT-DAO first then hopefully it will work on Catalyst. This is a prototype reputation system before DIDs. What isn't clear is how the tokens will be tracked and verified that the current holder is qualified to hold them. What if someone sells them? they will have immense reputation and credibility associated with them, how to protect from imposters?
assessments.reply: Agreed, we need to design around that concern of selling your reputation.  Although prostitution is an example of that, it is not something we are entertaining with this project. ;-)

assessments.note: The NFT-DAO EZ-Honor is an effective proposal that is seeking funding to grow an existing (claims 300+ members) DAO. The proposal if funded would seek to research and develop the tokenomics of participation awards. Presumably, the reward tokens would then be required for influence in community activities, as a token has to have utility in order to establish value. An unaddressed question is how the authority would be established to require tokens for voting or other activities.
assessments.reply: Agreed,  you bring up one of the imporant issues we seek to solve.

assessments.note: The proposal is from a strong group already committed to this task. It is well detailed and thus highly likely to be produced if funded.

The team of proposers already actively participates in the Cardano community. The NFT DAO was one of the proposals voted and approved by the community at Fund3. There are details about the experience of the proposers and their skills, signaling the qualification and aptitude of the team to execute the proposal.

There is a reasonable plan for the development of the proposal, there is a good definition of the timeline, there is information on the distribution of the budget during stages, but there are no details on the allocation of resources. I think it is important to detail how the resources will be used, even if it is entirely spent only on members' hours of work and research.

They already delivered the previous proposal to the end line, expanding the team. Yet transparent and promising team. 

 I could not join the discord. Idk why.

given the clear plan and strong team there is little doubt left. This is the first proposal I've seen that actually recognized the key funding dates within Project Catalyst, which signals that the team is in tune with the community and what's important.

The proposal is very detailed and provides concrete objectives which gives confidence that the objectives can be achieved. More information is needed regarding what will drive the value of the proposed NFT-DAO tokens. Exactly what utility will users be provided based on ownership of the tokens? If this is primarily the authority to vote, is that enough to establish value and under what circumstances.
This is a well thought out and resourced proposal to meet this challenge.

The proposal addresses the challenge in a relevant way and has great potential. There is a roadmap, with milestones, reasonable metrics, details about the proposers, their qualifications and experiences. I think it is important that the budget allocation is more detailed. There are no tangible KPIs.
assessments.reply: Agreed, it is very difficult to determine the KPIs that are truly meaningful without fully designing the outcome, which this proposal is seeking to accomplish.

assessments.note: provided in a detail. Overall, this proposal is one of the top tiers, which I assessed, both by "structure" and the "final product".
The proposal provides clear goals and expectations, and the success is auditable via blockchain data to find the token transactions as well as how they are being used in the community.
The proposal is very thorough. The existing Github repository has substantial content. The leadership team is well described. And there is an active community contributing to the project.

solution: Develop a staged approach to tokenomics that will enable a progression from simple, through intermediate to complex token incentivisation.
experience: NFT-DAO 38 active contributors, 12 engineers, several PhDs and candidates studying social systems and implementors of holonic systems.
